column4: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 20. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.
column6: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column8: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.

column2: 21. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
22. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: after it has been raining for an hour or more.
column6: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column8: the first rain after a dry spell.

column2: 23. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 24. Which statement about driving and drugs is true?
column4: Even over the counter drugs can impair your driving.
column6: Prescription drugs are safe to use if they don't make you feel drowsy.
column8: Only illegals drugs can impair your driving.

column2: 25. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
26. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column6: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.
column8: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.

column2: 27. When driving through a construction zone, drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop and watch for a flagger.

column2: 28. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
29. When approaching a construction site, drivers should:
column4: accelerate to get out of the way quickly.
column6: honk their horn to alert construction workers of their presence.
column8: slow down and adjust their driving manner.

column2: 30. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.
column6: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.

column2: 31. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column6: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.
column8: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.

column2: 32. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column4: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 33. Large trucks:
column4: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.
column6: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column8: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.

column2: 34. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
35. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column6: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.

column2: 36. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 37. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column6: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
column8: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.

column2: 38. If there is no crosswalk and you see a pedestrian crossing your lane, you should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing.
column6: make sure the pedestrian can see you before proceeding.
column8: honk your horn and proceed with caution.

column2: 39. The Implied Consent Law means that:
column4: drivers must submit to alcohol testing when asked by a police officer.
column6: drivers must drink more than three drinks to be tested for the amount of alcohol in their blood.
column8: drivers consent to have a blood sample taken if asked by an officer.

column2: 40. __________________ is a safe driving technique.
column4: Using your high beam lights in the fog
column8: Starring at the road ahead of your vehicle
